data.title: Books Received
data.text:
Agrawal, Arun and K. Sivaramakrishnan, eds. Agrarian environments: Resources, representation, and rule in India. Durham NC: Duke University Press, 2000. $19.95 (paper).

Akin, David and Joel Robbins, eds. Money and modernity: State and local currencies in Melanesia. Pittsburgh PA: University of Pittsburgh Press, 1999. (paper).

Amerlinck, Mari-jose, ed. Architectural anthropology. Westport CT: Bergin & Garvey, 2001. $69.95 (cloth).

Andrefsky, William, Jr., ed. Lithic debitage: Context, form, meaning. Salt Lake City: University of Utah Press, 2001. $50.00 (cloth).

Armstrong, Gary. Football hooligans. New York: New York University Press, 2001. $19.50 (paper).

Armstrong, Gary and Richard Giulianotti, eds. Fear and loathing in world football. New York: New York University Press, 2001. $22.50 (paper).

Arthur, Linda B., ed. Undressing religion: Commitment and conversion from a cross-cultural perspective. New York: New York University Press, 2001. $19.50 (paper).

Baer, Hans A. Biomedicine and alternative healing systems in America: Issues of class, race, ethnicity, and gender. Madison: University of Wisconsin Press, 2001. $21.95 (paper).

Beach, Hugh. A year in Lapland: Guest of the reindeer herders. Seattle: University of Washington Press, 2001. $19.95 (paper).

Benson, Elizabeth P. and Anita G. Cook, eds. Ritual sacrifice in ancient Peru. Austin: University of Texas Press, 2001. $19.95 (paper).

Binford, Lewis R. Constructing frames of reference: An analytical method for archaeological theory building using ethnographic and environmental data sets. Berkeley: University of California Press, 2001. $75.00 (cloth).

Biolsi, Thomas. Deadliest enemies: Law and the making of race relations on and off Rosebud Reservation. Berkeley: University of California Press, 2001. $35.00 (cloth).

Birth, Kevin. "Any time is Trinidad time: Social meanings and temporal consciousness. Gainesville: University Press of Florida, 1999. (cloth).

Blackwood, Evelyn. Webs of power: Women, kin, and community in a Sumatran village. Lanham MD: Rowman & Littlefield Publishers, 2000. (paper).

Böck, Monika and Aparna Rao, ed. Culture, creation and procreation: Concepts of kinship in South Asian practice. New York: Berghahn Books, 2001. $69.95 (cloth).

Brady, Erika, ed. Healing logics: Culture and medicine in modern health belief systems. Logan: Utah State University Press, 2001. $19.95 (paper).

Brysk, Alison. From tribal village to global village: Indian rights and international relations in Latin America. Stanford CA: Stanford University Press, 2000. (cloth).

Carile, Paolo. Le regard entravé: Littérature et anthropologie dans les premiers textes sur la nouvelle-France. Sillery, Québec: Septentrion, 2001. $24.95 (paper).

Castillo, Aída Hernández. Histories and stories from Chiapas: Border identities in southern Mexico. Austin TX: University of Texas Press, 2001. $22.95 (paper).

Castillo, Daisy Rubiera. Reyita: The life of a black Cuban woman in the twentieth century. Durham NC: Duke University Press, 2001. $16.95 (paper).

Conklin, Beth A. Consuming grief: compassionate cannibalism in an amazonian society. Austin: University of Texas, 2001. $22.95 (paper).

Crittenden, Patricia McKinsey and Angelika Hartl Claussen, eds. The organization of attachment relationships: Maturation, culture, and context. Cambridge UK: Cambridge University Press, 2000. (cloth).

Dávila, Arlene. Latinos Inc.: The marketing and making of a people. Berkeley: University of California Press, 2001. $22.50 (paper).

De Pina-Cabral, João and Antónia Pedroso de Lima. Elites: Choice, leadership and succession. New York: Berg, 2000. (paper).

Desai, Gaurav. Subject to colonialism: African self-fashioning and the colonial library. Durham NC: Duke University Press, 2001. $18.95 (paper).

DeVita, Philip R. Stumbling toward truth: Anthropologists at work. Prospect Heights IL: Waveland Press, 2000. (paper).

Dilley, Roy. The problem of context. New York: Berghahn Books, 1999. (cloth).

Dilmore, David D. Misogyny: The male malady. Philadelphia: University of Pennsylvania Press, 2001. $26.50 (paper).

Dore, Elizabeth and Maxine Molyneux, eds. Hidden histories of gender and the state in Latin America. Durham NC: Duke University Press, 2000. (paper).

Dresch, Paul, Wendy James, and David Parkin, eds. Anthropologists in a wider world: Essays on field research. New York: Berghahn Books, 2001. $69.95 (cloth).

Dyer, Christopher. Everyday life in medieval England. New York: Hambledon and London, 2001. $18.95 (paper).

Early, John D. and John F. Peters. The Xilixana Yanomami of the Amazon: History, social structure, and population dynamics. Gainesville: University Press of Florida, 2000. (cloth).

Edwards, Elizabeth. Raw histories: Photographs, anthropology and museums. New York: New York...
